task.summary: Default task

Configuration of login, both for administrator and customer. Administrators are blocked from access the main site and are forced to /admin if they try to access the regular site. Customer are forbidden from access /admin and sub-areas Controllers for /admin/{categories,products,settings} are properly configured (they were not before).
seeds.rb with basic information to populate the database with a default admin, and the two minimum necessary categories.

Bootstrap incorporated to apply style (gem) Font Awesome incorporated to apply style (css icons) (gem)
Layout for admin namespace added. Administrators do not navigate through the regular website.
Layout for login screen. Beautiful login screen
Basic design for admin area and home page
Two controllers added to easily share behaviours with admin controllers and other controllers (for regular users)
Method obtain(key) on model Setting to facilitate the recovery of settings from the database

Integration with CKEditor.
About and Contact pages are edited through CKEditor. Pages added manually.
Appropriated gems placed for add image upload functionality to CKEditor
JavaScripts for admin area are loaded only on admin dashboard (and application scripts are not, and vice-versa). Additionally, each controller under /admin loads a individual file rather than loading all files under /assets/javascripts/admin/*
Layouts for application and admin dashboard were broken down into partials to keep code maintainable.
config.js file added to assets, although it seems to be not working. I wanted to use the advanced CKEditor.

Integration of jsTree for eventually managing categories. A lot of work still has to be done for that.
Interface to recover json for a category's children via GET. No HTML rendering support. That is intended to be used by the jsTree futurely.
Image support for products using Paperclip
Form for products now shows the categories as a drop down menu. The parent categories are used as <optgroup> values and the children are the values for the user to assign to a product.

Using gem 'ancesty' to handle the categories as a tree. Necessary migration file created. The idea is to have categories and subcategories within one same table, so more level of categories can be added as necessary. This is just thinking about the expansions capabilities of the website.
Added assets for jsTree (/vendor) that I forgot to add on the previous commits :b
jsTree being able to create and rename categories through HTTP POST and PATCH respectively.

jsTree being able to move categories through HTTP PATCH, respecting the depth levels of the tree. This is, all nodes cannot change their depth during a moving operation through jsTree. Notice that it is not being restricted by the database yet.

jsTree being able to move categories through HTTP PATCH, respecting the depth levels of the tree. This is, all nodes cannot change their depth during a moving operation through jsTree. Notice that it is not being restricted by the database yet.

jsTree being able to remove categories through HTTP DELETE. Search bar added and a collapse/expand for the tree.
Migration: added foreign key constraint for products -> category_id
Option to change the website name added
Modal for errors display with a javascript method show_error_modal(title, content)
Route for GET /admin/categories/except/:id to get all the categories but the indicated one by :id and its children.

jsTree being able to remove categories through HTTP DELETE. Search bar added and a collapse/expand for the tree.
Migration: added foreign key constraint for products -> category_id
Option to change the website name added
Modal for errors display with a javascript method show_error_modal(title, content)
Route for GET /admin/categories/except/:id to get all the categories but the indicated one by :id and its children.
Price format for products Grams unit showed at the fields to inform in what unit we are working with

A better look for products/show page
Link 'show' corrected on edit file (was missing the admin namespace)
Shows icons for product availability and discount existence instead of showing 'true' or 'false' on pages, much more user friendly.
Add ability to remove a product's picture. Paperclip will render a default picture when that is the case

Script issue corrected. It was not being executed after loading a page on the same controller. Only for the first rendered page it was working. Solution found at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/28078480/rails-turbolinks-breaking-pnotify.
Initial design for homepage showing some products.
Breadcrumbs added for rails and pages for users.
Magnify feature added to images of products on homescreen.
Fix for menu area. For some reason, it was now occupying a huge vertical space.

Categories select added to search bar.
Categories controller added to customer namespace.

Categories select added to search bar.
Categories controller added to customer namespace.
Categories listing the products within it (without paginating yet)
Categories listing the products within it (without paginating yet)

Configuration of login, both for administrator and customer. Administrators are blocked from access the main site and are forced to /admin if they try to access the regular site. Customer are forbidden from access /admin and sub-areas Controllers for /admin/{categories,products,settings} are properly configured (they were not before).

Layouts for application and admin dashboard were broken down into partials to keep code maintainable.
